modules.pricechange
Class PriceChangeFrame

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container

                          modules.pricechange.PriceChangeFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
ComponentSelectionListener, WindowProcessTemplateListener, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class PriceChangeFrame
extends AbstractModelessWindow
implements ComponentSelectionListener

The main window frame for managaging Price Change data that is stored in the tables pc_change (the header table) and pc_item (the detail table).

Author:
rterrell

Method Detail

initFrame

protected void initFrame()
Performs specific constructor related tasks for this window.

Changes the text of the cancel and Ok buttons to "Exit PC List" and "Close PC", respectively. Adds the refresh button and dht find sku button and arranges the order which the buttons are displayed.

Overrides:

openSkuFinderWindow

protected void openSkuFinderWindow()
Opens the SKU Finder filter dialog in order to filter the result set by a specific SKU of the price change data grid.

This method is invoked when the user clicks the "Find PC(s)" button. Upon closing the SKU Finder dialog, a SKU is returned and a database query is performed to obtain a list of price changes pertaining the the said SKU.

refreshDataGrid

protected void refreshDataGrid(java.lang.String sku)
Queries the database for price changes records based on a specific SKU number and updates the price change grid with the results.

If sku is equal to null, then all active price change records are fetched. Nonetheless, the data price change grid is refreshed/reloaded with the results of the query. The window title will display differently based on the value of sku. When sku is null, the window title should display "Price Change List (All SKU's)". When sku contains a sku value, the title should display "Price Change List (SKU )".

Parameters:
sku - the sku number to fetch related price change records. Can be null which is indicative to return all price change records
Throws:
DatabaseException - Genereal database access errors.

updateSelectedItemStatus

protected void updateSelectedItemStatus(java.lang.String newStatus)
Changes the status of a price change record to newStatus.

The change is based on the selected item in the price change data grid. The value of newStatus must be either "O" or "C" which means reoopen and close, respectively. Otherwise, the method returns control to the caller without any actiion taken place.

Before the change request is performed, a popup dialog is displayed for the purpose of confirming the intent of the user. For example, when reopening a price change, the popup message will ask the user is he/she sure about reopening change #nnnnnnnn. Likewise, a similar message is shown for the case of closing a price change.

The status of a price change record can be changed to either "Open" or "Closed". If the selected record has a status of Open, then the new status will be "Closed". If the selected record has status of Closed, then the new status will be "Open".

Once the status change is made in the database, the list's data model will reflect the change immediately and the effected row will remain highlighted.

Parameters:
newStatus - the status to change the price change record to in which its valid values are "O" and "C" representing Open and Closed, respectively.

openDetailWindow

protected void openDetailWindow(PriceChange item)

handleDoubleClickedRow

public void handleDoubleClickedRow(ComponentItemDoubleClickedEvent evt)
Inovkes the Price Change Detail Edit process for the selected price change number.

handleSelectionChanged

public void handleSelectionChanged(ComponentItemSelectedEvent evt)
Dynamically manages the state of the Price Change Status button.

For all intents and purposes of this particular use case, this button state includes 1) the text that is displayed and 2) whether or not the button is enabled. The button's state change is based on the row currently selected in the data grid. The following rules apply for the button's state changes:

  1. When the selected record has a status of "O" (Open), the button's text will read "Close PC"
  2. When the selected record has a status of "C" (Closed), the button's text will read "Open PC"
  3. When the selected record has a status of "A" (Store Initiated), the button's text will read "Close PC" and the button will be disabled.

Specified by:
handleSelectionChanged in interface ComponentSelectionListener
Parameters:
evt - an instance of ComponentItemSelectedEvent

displayRecordCount
